title: Are humans able to cultivate or capture dark matter? - Quora

response.answer_text: As of now, nothing about the particulate nature of dark matter is known by us.  It is called dark matter as it does not interact with light and thus cannot be "seen" in a conventional way.  What we do know, is: a) that it is pressureless (the constituents do not collide with each other), b) it is acted upon by gravity, and c) it is not acted upon by electromagnetism.  Beyond this, we have no knowledge, and thus no detector technology that can "harvest" or capture dark matter. Dark matter is still a hypothesized form of matter that helps our theories to agree with observations extremely well. Particle theorists and experimentalists are still trying to find the "true" nature of it.

Dark matter is matter whose gravitational influence on other galaxies can be detected but which does not emit light. We don’t actually know what type of matter it is. Also, it is very, very far away. So to capture or cultivate it we’d have to know what it is first. It might not even be a single type of matter. Also, if it were up close, we’d probably be able to see it and it wouldn’t be “dark”.

We do not know Dark Matter as of yet. The answer to your question solely depends on whether we find it or not. Once we detect its existence, then I am pretty sure that we can understand it deeply-although more problems will arise-after overcoming all the problems.And if that happens, we can confidently and happily cultivate DM and keep it in a captured state if it were not too harmful to do so.

Humans don’t even have any idea about what they are. In fact, the fact that they couldn’t see it is the reason why they named it dark matter. Nothing is known about it. Only that it doesn’t radiate any energy (which is why we cannot see it). And that it has gravity. Let alone capturing or cultivating it.

Dark matter. Why is it named so? Because we simply don't know anything about it. We just know it holds galaxies in one place, when they're moving with very high speeds. Dark matter is nothing like the common matter we see . We cannot see it or touch it but just observe its effects. So when we know so little about something we can surely not cultivate or capture it.

Dark matter is a theory which the scientists have proposed to explain the mass anomalies in a galaxy .As for now the dark matter is a theoritical invisible chunk of mass. Experiments are being conducted to proove its existence but till now no success has been achieved .

Yes but only in our minds where such stuff lives, not “out there” in the world where we think we want it to be, do you understand? Dark matter was invented to explain some anomalous observations, or rather, interpretations of certain observations.
